title: MPs delegation seeks to sensitise U.K. lawmakers to Pak-sponsored terror attacks on India
content: Members of the multi-party delegation said that those they had met in Britain were receptive to India’s concerns and sympathetic its situation.

title: Tension at Palayam Market over demolition of shops
content: After initial attempt to remove materials from inside the shops and demolish the buildings were prevented by a section of the protesting traders, the drive continued with the support of the police

title: Judge, wife visit litigant’s bed-ridden father at home to find out his mental condition
content: Justice G.R. Swaminathan took his wife Kamakshi along, since she was a special educator with experience in dealing with mentally ill persons, and the couple found the octogenarian to be perfectly all right

title: As Kamal has decided against release of Thug Life in Karnataka, trade analysts expect 7% loss in total gross revenue
content:
According to producer and distributor G. Dhananjayan, the production house is likely to face a loss of ₹35 crore to ₹40 
crore in gross box office revenue and a loss of ₹12 crore to ₹15 
crore in producer share, if the film does not release in the neighbouring State

title: BJD accuses Odisha BJP State president of submitting false affidavits
content: The regional party demands Manmohan Samal, State BJP president, respond to show-cause notice issued by State Bar Council

title: Calcutta HC allows pleas challenging WBSSC teacher recruitment notification
content: Petitioners claim 2025 rules contravene Supreme Court directive; vacation Bench likely to hear case this week

title: Axiom-4 mission carrying Indian astronaut Shukla to International Space Station postponed to June 10
content: Mr. Shukla will be the second Indian to travel to space four decades after Rakesh Sharma's iconic spaceflight onboard Russia's Soyuz spacecraft in 1984.

title: Sacrificial slaughter not permitted in public places during Bakrid in Sambhal
content: The district administration held a peace committee meeting with various stakeholders, including representatives from areas where Eid prayers will be conducted

title: PM Modi will inaugurate Vande Bharat train service from Katra to Srinagar on June 6
content: Prior to the Pahalgam terror attack, Mr. Modi was set to travel to Srinagar for the inauguration. Now, he will flag off the train from Katra on Jammu side, officials said.

title: Government to move impeachment motion against Justice Varma during Monsoon Session
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju says he has started speaking to political parties to build consensus over this ‘non-political issue’.

title: Rahul Gandhi accuses PM Modi of ‘surrendering’ to U.S. pressure over Indo-Pak ceasefire
content: Congress leader cites Trump’s alleged intervention, asserts party’s commitment to ideological fight and social justice

title: Mayawati hits out at Bihar govt over death of Dalit rape victim
content: The former U.P. CM and a leading Dalit face pushed for strict legal action against all culprits and asked the Bihar government to ensure justice to the victim’s family

title: CPCL reworking configuration of Nagapattinam refinery, says its MD
content: The company is also looking at venturing into retail sales of petroleum products and about ₹400 crore has been set aside for the purpose, says MD H. Shankar

title: No contempt if Parliament, legislatures simply make laws: Supreme Court
content: "Every State Legislature has plenary powers to pass an enactment and so long as the said enactment has not been declared to be ultra vires the Constitution or, in any way, null and void by a constitutional court, the said enactment would have the force of law," says Bench

title: Jamaat condemns incidents of violence against Muslims
content: Country has witnessed a pattern of mob lynchings and hate crimes against Muslims, Dalits, and other marginalised groups in recent years, often under the guise of cow protection or love jihad, says vice-president of Jamaat-e-Islami Hind

title: HC sets aside local court’s gag order against media houses
content: The trial court’s ad-interim ex-parte injunction order against some newspapers, TV channels, web portals and media organisations directing them not report any defamatory content against Megha Engineering and Infrastructure Limited company and its management was “unreasoned”, a Division Bench ruled

title: Uttar Pradesh Cabinet approves 20% reservation for former Agniveers in police recruitment
content: ‘The main objective of this decision is to ensure meaningful post-service employment opportunities for Agniveers, who complete their four-year tenure under the Agneepath scheme,’ Suresh Kumar Khanna, U.P. Finance Minister, said

title: Karandlaje seeks NHRC intervention over ‘targeting’ of Hindutva groups in Dakshina Kannada
content: The police, acting under pressure from the Congress government, are ‘systematically targeting and harassing’ individuals associated with Hindutva organisations, social workers and traders in the district, alleges the Union Minister

title: With eye on Assembly polls, Bihar Cabinet approves 4,799 posts in different government departments
content: In another major decision, the Bihar Cabinet also reduced VAT rate from 29% to 4% on Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF)

title: MSC Irina, billed as largest ship in the world, calls at Vizhinjam
content: This is the first time MSC Irina, the lead ship of the MSC Irina-class, a series of six identical ultra-large container vessels, is sailing into the coast of a south Asian port

title: Bhu Bharati Act is a landmark legislation to find lasting solution to land disputes: Bhatti Vikramarka
content: We will review all those assigned lands, and issue rightful land titles to eligible beneficiaries. For the landless poor, we are restarting the Assigned Committees under the leadership of MLAs through the Bhu Bharati law to allocate agricultural land and housing plots, the Deputy Chief Minister said

title: New flight services between Vijayawada and Kurnool from July 2
content: Indigo will operate flights between Vijayawada and Kurnool every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, with plans to expand daily services soon

title: Urban governance today demands leadership, adaptability and community-centric thinking along with technical proficiency, says official
content: Our vision is to create a future-ready municipal workforce equipped with competencies to serve a fast-urbanising Andhra Pradesh: Suresh Kumar

title: Rahul criticises LIC over its investment in Adani group
content: Mr. Gandhi alleged that public funds of LIC collected through insurance premiums of common public have been invested by it in the Adani group.

title: Anna University’s study calls for  transition from the old shuttle looms to reduce noise pollution
content: The study, commissioned by the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board, recommends transition to shuttle-less looms, along with soundproofing measures, to bring the noise levels to the permissible residential standards

title: TTD temporarily shifts Divya Darshan token counters to Bhudevi Complex at Alipiri
content: The new arrangement will come into effect from June 6 evening; tokens will be issued to devotees preferring to trek to Tirumala via the Srivari Mettu footpath on first come, first served basis

title: Farooq, Mehbooba, Karra join Pandit devotees at the Mata Kheer Bhawani temple in Kashmir
content: ‘We are living in harmony; we will be living in harmony. We sent a message of happiness,’ NC president Farooq Abdullah said, calling for the peaceful return of Kashmiri Pandits to the Valley

title: Rapido draws flak for charging users extra for traffic delays, commuters term it ‘extortion’
content: The app offers the first 10 minutes of delay during the ride without charge, but thereafter charges ₹0.50 per minute upto ₹30, according to the users

title: Muslim Personal Law Board will not make Waqf Act an election issue but will take a call to intensify protests
content: If the government remains indifferent, our working committee will decide the next course. Whether it is courting arrest, a jail bharo movement, or peaceful roadblocks. We’re encouraged by the support of many Hindu brothers, and civil rights groups who stand with us. It is possible that negative practices like caste discrimination have entered the Muslim community on account of shared experiences, or influences from others. But Islam rejects caste. We look at it as a social evil

title: Pact signed appointing IIT Madras as consultant for fixing structural issues in Mundamveli apartment complex
content: IIT Madras has been given four months to study and recommend lasting solutions to sustain the apartment complex in the long term

title: Dalit minor rape case: Bihar government takes action against two medical officials
content: The 11-year old child was raped and found with nearly 20 knife wounds in Muzaffarpur on May 26; she died at the PMCH on June 1 after waiting in the ambulance for over five hours, waiting to be admitted

title: nirmalCOVID surge calls for precautions, not for alarm
content: Masking in public places, especially hospitals or closed spaces, should become a norm for the elderly, pregnant women, and those with chronic comorbidities

title: Delhi police bust pan-India cybercrime syndicate
content: It was involved in bank frauds, whose network was operating through multiple verticals, including fake loan call centres and an orchestrated sextortion racket

title: Excise Dept. registers 2.04 lakh cases in three years; ₹102 cr. worth of goods seized
content: Around 1.43 lakh cases have been booked for allowing or consuming liquor in an unlicensed public place

title: Vikrama Simhapuri University implements dual major programmes
content: Effective implementation of ABC system enables students to store credits got from various educational institutions across the country on a unified digital platform, says VSU Vice-Chancellor

title: In West Bengal, a clash of poets over the skipping of a State-sponsored poetry festival
content: Allegations of irregularities surface as West Bengal Poetry Academy faces criticism over non-conduct of Kabita Utsav

title: Price of Totapuri mangoes fixed at ₹12,000 per tonne by Chittoor district administration
content: Have discussed at length the problems faced by mango farmers, as well as the managements of mango pulp industries, and fixed the price, says Chittoor Collector

title: Revised ward delimitation of Thiruvananthapuram Corporation issued; Corporation to have 101 wards
content: Previous one released last week faced criticisms over errors in demarcating boundaries between wards. The newly formed wards are Sainik School ward, Chenkottukonam, Karyavattom, Pangappara, Alathara, Kuzhivila, Ambalamukku, Gowreesapattom, and Karumam

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Properties worth over ₹7 crore attached in a ‘disproportionate assets’ case
content: The investigation revealed that Amit Nigam, serving in various Income Tax Department roles from 2008 to 2018, allegedly acquired assets worth over ₹7.52 crore through corrupt practices

title: Social forestry wing halts distribution of tree saplings as govt. cuts fund
content: The social forestry wing has been distributing tree saplings on Environment Day to schools and other institutions, aiming to encourage green cover

title: Buehler back to the Dodgers? A star shortstop on the move? Passan’s latest trade intel on all 30 teams
content: As MLB trade season starts up, here are the biggest names who could move -- and the teams that could deal for them.

title: Sources: Steelers unlikely to trade for TE Smith
content: The Steelers are not expected to trade for Dolphins tight end Jonnu Smith after engaging in talks with Miami but now will host free agent Gabe Davis on a visit this week

title: Brind'Amour says handshake line for coaches, too
content: Hurricanes coach Rod Brind'Amour said he was surprised when Panthers coach Paul Maurice asked him not to participate in their series-ending handshake line last week.

title: Wake baseball coach apologizes for anti-gay slur
content: Wake Forest and baseball coach Tom Walter apologized for what appeared to be an anti-gay slur caught by TV cameras during a game against Tennessee.

title: Texans not worried about Stroud's sore shoulder
content: The Texans have "no concerns" about quarterback C.J. Stroud's limited throwing during spring practices due to "general soreness" in his shoulder, coach DeMeco Ryans said Tuesday.

title: Inzaghi leaves Inter amid reported Saudi interest
content: Inter Milan have confirmed that Simone Inzaghi has left the club following the team's 5-0 Champions League final defeat to PSG on Saturday.

title: Peyton Manning joins Denver NWSL ownership
content: Hall of Fame quarterback Peyton Manning has joined the ownership group of the Denver NWSL expansion franchise that will begin play next year.

title: WNBA's Taylor joins Grand Canyon as assistant
content: Celeste Taylor, a former guard with the Mercury who has been dealing with a foot injury, is joining Grand Canyon as an assistant coach, she told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Musetti warned for kicking ball at Paris line judge
content: Lorenzo Musetti was warned for unsportsmanlike conduct for kicking a tennis ball that inadvertently hit a linesperson during his French Open quarterfinal against Frances Tiafoe.

title: 📈 WNBA Power Rankings: Who holds top spot?
content: Las Vegas, Washington and Chicago join Atlanta as risers as the league begins Commissioner's Cup play.

title: College football FPI release: Team projections for the 2025 season
content: Does the SEC remain on top? Will Boise State revisit the CFP? Here's what stands out from ESPN's latest data.

title: Reacting to the preseason FPI rankings: Who's overvalued, who's undervalued
content: The first FPI for the 2025 season is out, and ESPN's college football reporters are here to break it down.

title: SGA at No. 1, Haliburton at No. 2 ... then who? We ranked the top 20 players in Thunder-Pacers
content: Two of the league's deepest teams are meeting in the Finals. Here are the top 20 players in this championship series.

title: Playoff MVPs: Superstar guards lead our pre-Finals update
content: SGA or Tyrese Haliburton for the top spot? Which conference finals stars cracked the list? We weigh in.

title: Why the Panthers will win the Stanley Cup (again)
content: Though Edmonton enters the Cup Final as the favorite, there are five reasons why Florida will repeat.

title: Barnwell: Signings and trades who will benefit most from a new team this season
content: Which signings and traded players benefited most from moving to a new NFL organization over the past few months? Let's evaluate 15 additions.

title: Trae, KAT, Luka and the NBA's biggest extension decisions
content: Which stars will sign extensions and which should wait it out? Bobby Marks examines the futures of 16 players.

title: Three potential Cooper Flagg trades the Mavericks might not immediately reject
content: What if the Mavs traded the draft's top pick? Our NBA insiders offer three enticing offers -- and a verdict.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Inter to offer Højlund an escape from Man United
content: Rasmus Højlund looks set to leave Man United, with Inter Milan keen to bring the striker back to Serie A. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Betting interest on Fever games dips by half after Caitlin Clark injury
content: Caitlin Clark's quad injury has had a ripple effect on the WNBA, including the betting interest in the Indiana Fever and the sport over the past week.

title: With Bryce Huff trade, 49ers continue remaking defense in Robert Saleh's image
content: If Saleh can jump-start Huff back closer to his 2023 levels, the Niners will have options to create havoc up front.

title: Did the 49ers or Eagles win the Bryce Huff deal? We graded the trade
content: The 49ers are taking a chance on Huff, who disappointed in his only season in Philly. Did they give up too much?

title: There's more to Merab Dvalishvili's game than just takedowns
content: The UFC bantamweight champion will try to take Sean O'Malley to the mat at UFC 316. What he does from there will determine if he keeps the belt.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Charlo returns, Plant down four spots at super middleweight
content: Jermell Charlo's victory brings him back to the top 10 at 168 pounds, but where does he land? Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 'I can't go on': The moment a 14-year-old Mike Tyson nearly quit in the ring
content: Mark Kriegel's excerpt from "Baddest Man: The Making of Mike Tyson" looks at the fights of a 14-year-old Tyson.

title: Florida, Houston rise in our men's NCAA top 25 after NBA draft withdrawal deadline
content: Did the Gators or Cougars do enough to earn No. 1? How the latest key offseason date shifted our projections.

title: Will anyone fill Nadal's beloved shoes at the French Open?
content: Nadal has left an indelible mark on the French Open -- but Swiatek, Alcaraz and others may be able to carry on the legacy.

title: Odds, post positions for the Belmont Stakes
content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the eight-horse field for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

title: Is the future of soccer in new, chaotic tournaments fueled by viral moments and celebrities?
content: Alternative soccer tournaments driven by celebrities, viral moments and huge cash prizes are all the rage. Are they the future of the sport, too?

title: Sources: Bruno snubs Saudi offer, to stay at Utd
content: Manchester United believe Bruno Fernandes is set to stay at the club this summer despite interest from Al Hilal, sources have told ESPN.

title: Yamal: Spain-France can be Ballon d'Or decider
content: Yamal is happy to bill Spain's UEFA Nations League semifinal against France as a Ballon d'Or decider between him and Dembélé if that's what people want.

title: Source: Chelsea to send Sancho back to Man Utd
content: Jadon Sancho is set to return to Manchester United after Chelsea failed to agree personal terms on a permanent deal, a source has told ESPN.

title: UK threatens to sue Abramovich over Chelsea sale
content: Britain has threatened to take Russian businessman Roman Abramovich to court over the frozen £2.5 billion ($3.4bn) in proceeds from his sale of Chelsea soccer club that he wanted to go to victims of Russia's war in Ukraine.

title: Injured Gyökeres withdraws from Sweden squad
content: Viktor Gyökeres has pulled out of the Sweden squad for their upcoming friendlies against Hungary and Algeria because of an injury.

title: Sources: England train in tents to mimic U.S. heat
content: England have begun training in specially-heated tents to replicate conditions at next summer's World Cup finals, sources have told ESPN.

title: Messi a factor as Rodríguez weighs club future
content: Club América's Brian Rodríguez admitted that the possibility of featuring alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suárez at Inter Miami CF plays a role in his decision-making process as he considers a move away from the Liga MX team.

title: 2nd-tier Roots hire ex-U.S. star Feilhaber as coach
content: Former U.S. national team midfielder Benny Feilhaber was hired Monday as coach of the Oakland Roots of the United Soccer League's second-tier Championship.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Messi, Suárez help Miami surge up the list
content: With nine goals in two games, it's official: Inter Miami are back! Just how far have Messi & Co. jumped up ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: Has Verstappen's Spanish GP tantrum cost him F1 title shot?
content: Max Verstappen is already on the back foot in the F1 title fight. His Spain outburst didn't help his cause.

title: Asim Munir Turned Against Imran Khan's Wife After Dismissal As Spy Agency Chief
content: Imran Khan spoke about the "vindictive nature" of Army Chief Gen Asim Munir saying the field marshal turned against his wife, Bushra Bibi, after being removed from the post of director general of Inter-Services Intelligence.

title: Satellite Pics Show How Russia Tried To Avert Ukraine Drone Strikes, But Failed
content: Hi-resolution satellite imagery of air bases deep inside Russia, taken before Ukraine carried out what's been described as the most audacious drone attack in military history, shows several Russian Air Force jets parked on the tarmac.

title: A Summer That Isn't? Why 2025 Is Becoming Climate Case Study for India
content: A January that didn't feel like winter and a May that did not feel like summer - the year 2025 is emerging as a case study in understanding the impact of climate change in India.

title: Air Quality Body Takes Steps In Punjab, Haryana To Fight Air Pollution In And Around Delhi
content: Considering the perennial issue of north India's smog-choked winter, the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) is striking at two major pollution culprits - paddy stubble burning and open municipal solid waste (MSW) fires.

title: Child Abducted, Mutilated By 'Wolves' In UP's Bahraich
content: A mutilated body of a two-year-old boy was found in a field in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, possibly dragged there and mauled by an animal.

title: Judge In Cash Row To Face Impeachment Motion In Next House Session: Sources
content: The Centre is preparing to initiate impeachment proceedings against sitting High Court judge, Justice Yashwant Varma, facing allegations of corruption after the discovery of a large amount of cash from his residence in Delhi, say sources.

title: Harvey Weinstein Lawyer Asks Jury To Give Him Benefit Of The Doubt
content: The lawyer defending fallen Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein from rape and sexual assault charges called on jurors to give him the benefit of the doubt Tuesday before prosecutors make their closing argument at his retrial.

title: 'No Talks On Sunday Work, Staring At Wife': Harsh Goenka's Speech Is Viral
content: Harsh Goenka, it appears, played it straight and safe. There was no mention of working on Sundays. There was also no mention of staring at spouses. The billionaire businessman underlined that he did not speak about these things at all.

title: On Op Sindoor's Success, Ex Army Chief's "3 Factors Of Atmanirbharta"
content: The success of Operation Sindoor also traces its roots in the steps taken towards self-reliance and the focus on indigenous equipment in the last decade, former Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande (retired) told NDTV.

title: Delhi Public Works Department Posts Pictures Of Workers Entering Drain. Then Deletes
content: Armed with just a shovel, a group of labourers, with no protective gear of gloves, entered the sewers in Delhi's Rohini, in violation of the Supreme Court order.

title: UP Boy Dies After Being Hit By Ball While Playing Cricket
content: A 12-year-old boy died after being hit in the chest by a cricket ball during a match in Tundla town of Firozabad district.

title: Ukraine Says It Hit Russia's Bridge To Crimea With Underwater Explosives
content: Ukraine's SBU security service said on Tuesday that it had hit the road and rail bridge linking Russia and the Crimean peninsula below the water level with explosives.

title: Tesla India Takes On Lease 24,565 Sq Ft Warehousing Space In Mumbai
content: Tesla India has taken on lease 24,565 square feet warehousing space in Lodha Logistics Park in Mumbai at a starting monthly rent of Rs 37.53 lakh.

title: US Researchers Develop New mRNA Vaccine To Fight Covid-19
content: A team of US researchers has developed a new type of mRNA vaccine that is more scalable and adaptable to tackle continuously evolving viruses such as SARS-CoV-2 and H5N1.

title: Land-For-Jobs Case: Applicants From 1 State, Recruitment Pattern Under Probe
content: The CBI, presenting its arguments on framing charges in the land-for-job scam case, questioned how all applicants for Group D posts in some zones of Indian Railways could come from just one state.

title: Land Belonging To PoK-Based Terrorist Attached In Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban
content: Land belonging to a terrorist operating from Pakistan-occupied Kashmir was attached under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act in Ramban district of Jammu and Kashmir.

title: 34 Airlifted From North Sikkim After Landslide, More Rescuers Flown In
content: Two Mi-17 V5 helicopters rescued 34 people from Chhaten and Lachen villages in Sikkim's Magan district, with road commute dampened by a major landslide on June 1.

title: Video: Truck Jumps Divider, Crashes Into Motorcycle In Andhra Pradesh
content: Two people were injured after a tipper truck lost control and crashed into a motorcycle on a highway in Andhra Pradesh.

title: Not A Single Case In Kerala Film Industry Sex Abuse Report To Be Pursued As Survivors Avoid Recording Statements
content: For all the uproar created by the Justice K Hema Committee report, no real legal progress seems to have been made in taking forward the 120 police cases filed based on the findings of a special investigation team (SIT) formed by Kerala government.

title: Goof-up! Ravi Shastri's toss blunder leaves fans in splits – WATCH
content: Ravi Shastri, the veteran commentator, made a comical blunder during the IPL 2025 final toss presentation between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings. Shastri incorrectly announced that Punjab Kings skipper Shreyas Iyer had chosen to bat after he had actually elected to bowl. The incident quickly sparked a meme fest on social media, with fans reacting to Shastri's mix-up.

title: Watch: Ukraine uses 1,100 kg of underwater explosives to hit Russia’s key bridge
content: Ukraine's security service (SBU) has claimed responsibility for an underwater explosion that damaged Russia's crucial bridge linking to Crimea, utilizing 1,100 kilograms of explosives. The SBU stated the operation, which targeted the bridge's underwater pillars, had been planned for months. This incident follows a prior Ukrainian drone attack on Russian bomber planes, highlighting escalating tensions.

title: 'Virat Kohli will continue playing Tests': RCB star trolled
content: In the IPL 2025 final, Virat Kohli's cautious 43 off 35 balls wasn't enough as Royal Challengers Bengaluru aimed for their maiden title. Azmatullah Omarzai's stunning caught-and-bowled dismissed Kohli, leaving him visibly disappointed. Punjab Kings, led by Shreyas Iyer, chose to field first, setting the stage for a new IPL champion as both teams vied for their first trophy.

title: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis: If I were a student right now, I would study ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: Virat Kohli's 'iconic jump' goes viral after Shreyas Iyer falls for 1 in IPL Final
content: In the IPL 2025 final, Virat Kohli's RCB posted 190/9, struggling to build scoreboard pressure despite a brisk powerplay start. Kohli's conservative 43 off 35 balls and key wickets at crucial moments hampered their progress. PBKS captain Shreyas Iyer walked after edging one behind, acknowledging the faint edge, while Jamieson's three wickets and Arshdeep's final over brilliance restricted RCB.

title: Kim Moon Soo concedes defeat, Lee Jae-myung to take over as South Korea’s president
content: Kim Moon Soo conceded defeat in South Korea's presidential election, paving the way for Lee Jae-myung's immediate inauguration. Lee's victory follows political turmoil after Yoon Suk Yeol's ousting, with Lee promising a stronger, equitable nation and pragmatic diplomacy. He faces challenges including US tariff hikes and pledges to investigate Yoon's martial law decision.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on his sleep goal; emphasises its importance, says he tries to clock 6 hours
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai revealed his approach to managing a demanding schedule, emphasizing the importance of sleep and aiming for six hours nightly. He acknowledges the tech industry's dynamic nature and his tendency to be a late-night person. Pichai starts his day with Techmeme, a tech news aggregator also favored by other tech executives.

title: Aakash moves NCLT to implead EY, alleges conflict in Byju’s petition
content: Aakash Educational Services Ltd (AESL) has petitioned the NCLT, Bengaluru, to dismiss Byju's petition, alleging a conflict of interest involving Ernst & Young (EY) and partner Ajay Shah. AESL claims EY's past advisory roles in challenged transactions compromise the Resolution Professional's independence. The plea includes internal communications and accusations of suppressed facts and procedural lapses.

title: Anushka Sharma’s disappointed look says it all after Virat Kohli’s dismissal
content: In the 2025 IPL final, Anushka Sharma watched as Virat Kohli's RCB faced Punjab Kings. Kohli, opening the batting, surpassed Shikhar Dhawan for the most IPL fours, reaching 769. However, his innings was cut short at 43, leading to a quiet reaction from the RCB camp and Anushka, highlighting the personal stakes for players and their families.

title: Jay Shah in the stands with family during high-voltage IPL 2025 final
content: The IPL 2025 final between RCB and PBKS at Narendra Modi Stadium witnessed BCCI honoring the Indian Armed Forces. Jay Shah and family attended the title clash preceded by a patriotic musical tribute led by Shankar Mahadevan. The IPL 2025 season had earlier been paused for a week due to rising tensions between India and Pakistan. Following a ceasefire agreement between the two nations, the tournament resumed with a revised schedule, pushing the final from its original May 26 date to June 3.

title: Anand Mahindra on Carlsen’s reaction after losing to D Gukesh: ‘Wasn’t just a…’
content: D Gukesh, the youngest World Chess Champion, defeated Magnus Carlsen at the Norway Chess tournament, earning praise from Anand Mahindra. Gukesh's composed victory contrasted with Carlsen's frustration, marking a milestone in his career with his first classical win against the world champion. He now stands third in the tournament, closely trailing Carlsen and Caruana.

title: Kannada row: Kamal Haasan refuses to apologise in HC, postpones movie release in Karnataka
content: The Karnataka High Court adjourned the hearing on 'Thug Life' film ban, prompted by Kamal Haasan's remarks about the Kannada language's origin. The court questioned Haasan's refusal to apologize, drawing parallels to C. Rajagopalachari's past apology.

title: 'Trump said stop, PM Modi stopped': Rahul renews attack over Op Sindoor ceasefire
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's ceasefire agreement with Pakistan after Operation Sindoor, alleging it was a 'surrender' influenced by Donald Trump. He contrasted this with Indira Gandhi's strong leadership during the 1971 war. Gandhi also accused the BJP and RSS of easily succumbing to pressure, highlighting the Congress Party's history of resistance.

title: CDS Chauhan reveals how Pak’s '48-hour plan to cripple India' crumbled in just 8 hours
content: CDS General Anil Chauhan emphasised the resilience of professional military forces, stating that setbacks don't diminish their effectiveness, days after acknowledging fighter jet losses during Operation Sindoor. He highlighted adaptability and learning from mistakes as crucial. Chauhan asserted that Pakistan shouldn't hold India hostage to terrorism, referencing the Pahalgam attack's brutality and India's history as a major terror victim.

title: The word 'intent' was missing from Virat Kohli's knock
content: Virat Kohli scored a 35-ball 43 in the IPL final against Punjab Kings. Kohli looked to bat through, as he usually does in big games, but failed to do so and never looked to accelerate on an Ahmedabad pitch, where anything below 200 is a below-par total. After being put into bat first, RCB scored 190 for 9.

title: Eid-ul-Adha 2025 wishes: Eid Mubarak top 50 messages, quotes, and wishes
content: Eid-ul-Adha, also known as Bakrid, a festival of sacrifice, will be observed on June 7, 2025. Muslims worldwide celebrate with prayers, feasts, and charitable acts, reflecting on faith and generosity. The occasion commemorates Prophet Ibrahim's devotion and encourages believers to uphold their faith. Share heartfelt wishes and motivational quotes to spread love, kindness, and unity during this sacred time.

title: IPL 2025 Final: Shreyas Iyer roars as PBKS land early blow on RCB
content: Shreyas Iyer's fired-up celebration after catching Phil Salt ignited Punjab Kings' IPL 2025 Final. Iyer's early breakthrough and energy set the tone as PBKS aims to control the game. RCB, despite Salt's early dismissal, still possesses the firepower to post a competitive total, with Virat Kohli and Mayank Agarwal at the crease.

title: Two students among 3 held for dragging police barricade with SUV in Noida
content: In Noida, three men were arrested after a viral video showed their SUV dragging a police barricade. The incident, which occurred in February, involved Nishant Pandit, his brother Sourabh Pandit, and their friend Aryakeet, all residents of Ecotech 3.

title: Contractor buried and plastered in wall, aunt held in West Bengal
content: Malda Police discovered the body of Saddam Nadap, a labour contractor, buried within a wall of a house in South Dinajpur's Tapan, following a missing person report filed by his wife. The investigation led to Moumita Hasan, Saddam's aunt and alleged lover, who confessed to the crime, citing blackmail and threats from the victim.

title: Tesla accelerates India strategy with new office lease in Mumbai’s Kurla
content: Tesla is expanding its presence in India, leasing a new 24,500 sq ft office space in Kurla West, Mumbai, to bolster its manufacturing and supply chain activities. This five-year lease, with a starting monthly rent of Rs 37.53 lakh, marks Tesla's fourth office in India, signaling a growing commitment to the Indian market following policy adjustments encouraging EV investment.

title: MP CM criticises Rahul for wearing shoes while paying tribute to Indira Gandhi
content: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav criticized Rahul Gandhi for allegedly disrespecting Indian culture by not removing his shoes while paying tribute to Indira Gandhi's statue in Bhopal. Gandhi's visit included launching Congress's ‘Sangathan Srijan Abhiyan’ to strengthen the party for the 2028 state elections. Yadav stated that Gandhi's actions were against Indian 'sanskar' and should be avoided.

title: Gas cylinder catches fire near Narendra Modi Stadium hours before IPL final
content: A gas cylinder ignited outside a shop near Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Tuesday morning, just hours before the IPL 2025 final match. Local residents and the fire brigade responded swiftly, extinguishing the flames and preventing any injuries. Authorities are investigating the cause of the fire, which raised safety concerns given the large crowd expected for the evening's event.

title: Goosebumps! Virat makes grand entry, Ahmedabad can't keep calm
content: Virat Kohli's entry into the IPL 2025 final at Narendra Modi Stadium was met with thunderous applause as RCB faced PBKS. Shreyas Iyer chose to bowl after winning the toss. Kohli, seeking his first IPL title, stepped onto the field amidst immense pressure, hoping to lead RCB to victory in what could be a defining moment.

title: UAE Golden Visa vs Trump's US Golden Visa: Which one is better for you?
content: As the race for the global elite’s loyalty intensifies, two nations have rolled out the red carpet with the same golden promise: permanent residency without strings. On one side is the UAE’s well-established Golden Visa scheme—sleek, efficient, and tax-friendly. On the other, Donald Trump’s revived version of the EB-5 Investor Visa—controversial, political, but undeniably powerful. So which one is better for high-net-worth individuals, entrepreneurs, and ambitious expats?

title: IPL closing ceremony: Shankar Mahadevan honours Indian Armed Forces
content: Shankar Mahadevan and his sons, Siddharth and Shivam, delivered a musical tribute to the Indian armed forces at the IPL 2025 closing ceremony in Ahmedabad. The performance preceded the RCB vs PBKS match. This year's IPL faced a week-long suspension due to tensions between India and Pakistan following Operation Sindoor, India's response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Mann sparks row with 'one nation, one husband' remark; BJP terms it 'vulgar'
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's remarks regarding Operation Sindoor, labeling them as disgraceful and vulgar. Mann questioned the BJP's Sindoor distribution initiative, leading to accusations of insulting the symbol of love and sacrifice for Indian women.

title: Izz al-Din al-Haddad set to lead Hamas after former chief killed in Israeli strike
content: Izz al-Din al-Haddad is poised to become Hamas's new leader after Muhammad Sinwar's death in an Israeli airstrike. As the most senior surviving commander from Hamas's pre-war Gaza leadership, al-Haddad is expected to assume operational control. He previously led the Izz al-Din al-Qassam Brigades in Gaza City and played a key role in the October 7 attacks.

title: 'Wait has been long enough': Robin Uthappa sends emotional message to RCB
content: Ahead of the Indian Premier League 2025 final clash between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings, former RCB player Robin Uthappa has passionately voiced his support for his former team. In a video message, Uthappa acknowledged both teams' impressive journeys but expressed his strong desire to see RCB lift the trophy.

title: Tanker overturns on Varanasi–Lucknow highway; video shows villagers looting oil
content: A road accident in Amethi turned into a looting spree. A tanker overturned on the Varanasi-Lucknow highway. Instead of helping the injured driver, villagers stole the spilled refined oil. They used cans and buckets to collect the oil. Police intervened to disperse the crowd and take the driver to the hospital. The incident sparked debate about apathy and desperation.

title: Exclusive | Rishi Sunak rooting for RCB in IPL final: 'Cheered them from Downing Street'
content: Former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has declared his support for Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in the IPL final against Punjab Kings, citing strong family ties to Bengaluru. Sunak revealed he received an RCB jersey as a wedding gift and has been an avid follower ever since, even cheering them on at Downing Street.

title: 'RRR' got 'SMS' to put nation before party, family: BJP mocks Congress
content: Shehzad Poonawalla, BJP spokesperson, targeted Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Revanth Reddy, and Jairam Ramesh. He called them 'RRR'. Poonawalla accused them of echoing Pakistan's views on Operation Sindoor. He cited criticism from Congress members Shashi Tharoor, Manish Tewari, and Salman Khurshid. These members are part of diplomatic outreach. Poonawalla urged 'RRR' to prioritize the nation over party interests.

title: Why Tata Motors didn’t rebrand ‘Harrier’ EV: Company eyes 50% EV share
content: Tata Passenger Electric Mobility has launched the Harrier EV, expanding its EV lineup to six models. The Harrier EV targets tech-savvy professionals seeking enhanced performance and premium features in the growing large SUV segment. It boasts 500 Nm of torque, all-wheel drive, and advanced technology like a Samsung Neo QLED screen, aiming for a 50% EV market share.

title: Over 56,000 people affected, 10,477 houses damaged in Manipur floods
content: Manipur is grappling with severe flash floods affecting over 56,000 people, triggered by overflowing rivers and breached embankments. Thousands of homes have been damaged, and nearly 3,000 residents evacuated, primarily from Imphal East. A person is missing after being swept away by a river.

title: Indian YouTuber causes uproar with vulgar remarks on Turkish woman
content: Malik SD Khan, an Indian YouTuber, sparked outrage after posting offensive videos from Turkey. He made derogatory comments about Turkish women and disrespected a shopkeeper. Turkish citizens demanded legal action, and Khan was reportedly detained. He later apologized for his actions. Social media users supported the police action, emphasizing the importance of respecting other cultures while traveling.

title: Pakistan jailbreak: Over 200 prisoners flee during earthquake evacuation in Karachi
content: In Karachi, over 100 inmates escaped from Malir prison after earthquake tremors prompted an evacuation. Prisoners attacked guards, seizing weapons and fleeing before dawn. While 78 have been recaptured, police are searching for the remaining escapees. One inmate died and three officers were injured in a shootout. Authorities are urging the escapees to surrender, warning of potential terror charges.

title: Students at Meerut university score 78 and 80 out of 70 marks
content: Chaudhary Charan Singh University (CCSU) in Meerut faced uproar after MA Home Science students received inflated marks, exceeding the maximum possible score in the Food Science practical exam. The Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) protested, demanding a probe into the grading irregularities.

title: Magnus Carlsen meltdown: Pieces fly off the board as D Gukesh shocks World No. 1
content: In a stunning upset at Norway Chess, D Gukesh defeated Magnus Carlsen for the first time in a classical game, marking a historic moment. Carlsen's blunder under time pressure led to a dramatic win for the Indian champion. Gukesh's victory is a morale-booster, placing him among the few Indians to achieve this feat against Carlsen as world No. 1.

title: 'RCB will win': Sehwag's 'reverse jinx' leaves fans in splits ahead of IPL final
content: Ahead of the highly anticipated IPL 2025 final between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings, Virender Sehwag playfully predicts an RCB victory. Paying a reverse psychology, Sehwag humorously suggests his support often dooms a team. He hopes his backing of RCB will inadvertently favour Punjab Kings, as both teams vie for their first-ever IPL title.

title: Who is Curtis Yarvin? Meet the ‘intellectual source code’ of Trump administration
content: Curtis Yarvin, once a tech entrepreneur, now fuels the anti-democracy movement influencing Donald Trump's policies. His vision, advocating for CEO-style autocracy and dismantling democratic norms, resonates within Trump's inner circle. Yarvin's ideas, promoting elite rule and corporate governance, are shaping policies and rhetoric on the American right, potentially leading towards a post-democratic future.

title: ‘Give your best offers by…’: Trump admin pushes countries to urgently finalise trade deals
content: The Trump administration is pushing for swift trade deal conclusions, urging nations to submit optimal proposals. This urgency follows initial tariff suspensions and market reactions. While a preliminary agreement exists with Britain, the U.S. seeks comprehensive offers on tariffs, quotas, digital commerce, and economic security from partners like the EU, Japan, Vietnam, and India.

title: IPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS: Will rain play spoilsport in Ahmedabad?
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings are set to battle it out in the IPL 2025 final in Ahmedabad. Both teams are vying for their first title, with Virat Kohli leading RCB's charge. The weather forecast predicts clear skies and no rain, ensuring an uninterrupted and thrilling contest for the coveted trophy.

title: 'What if China stops Brahmaputra water?': Assam CM shuts down 'Pak's scare narrative'
content: Assam's Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma refuted Pakistan's claims about China potentially weaponizing the Brahmaputra River. Sarma clarified that the Brahmaputra is primarily fed by Indian monsoon rains, with China contributing only a smaller portion of its flow. He dismissed the concerns as fear-mongering, highlighting India's dominant role in sustaining the river's volume and asserting its water sovereignty.

content: "the last game I thought I was ever going to play in a Bruins jersey," he says . a rematch between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers is an "incredible final" he didn't want to leave the team that drafted him in 2006 .

title: Madden NFL 26 cover star Saquon Barkley's ratings throughout his career
content: saquon Barkley is the cover star of the upcoming iteration of the football sim . he is the first member of the 99 club -- the illustrious circle of athletes starting the season with a 99 OVR . his debut performance, which netted him NFL Offensive Rookie of the Year, added nine points to his initial rating .

title: Regrading last summer's biggest transfers: Which club earned an A? Which got a D?
content: from 1992 through 2021, just 54% of all the players brought in for €10 million started at least 50% of the matches in their first two seasons . 370 premier league clubs made 370 signings for the past season . only 25 were on the field for 70% of the minutes .

title: Conn Smythe Watch: Connor McDavid for MVP of the playoffs -- win or lose?
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs are down to their final two teams . the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers meet for the second straight season . one of the players in this series is going to win the Conn Smythe as NHL postseason MVP .

title: Caglianone, Mauricio and other prospects on the rise
content: 1B Jac Caglianone is slated to make his MLB debut on Tuesday . he hit 15 home runs over 50 games and 228 plate appearances this season . there is a clear path for him to be a top-10 first baseman in fantasy .

title: How NiJaree Canady became college softball's first million-dollar player
content: the 2024 USA Collegiate Softball player of the year is reshaping college softball . she landed the richest softball deal ever . her new home would be on the arid plains of west Texas at a school .
